CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Non-pecuniary damage - finding of violation sufficient;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant concluded a contract with ORG ( an insurance company incorporated in GPE ) , according to which she paid an insurance premium in exchange for an annuity .

CARDINAL . Since ORG failed to pay the annuity at the term , the applicant brought a civil action against it , seeking the payment of the pension to date and requiring the company to abide by the contract .
CARDINAL . On DATE , ORG found in favour of the applicant and ordered ORG to pay the pension due and to resume the execution of the contract .

CARDINAL . ASITO appealed against this judgment , asking inter alia for the cancellation of the contract concluded with the applicant in DATE on the ground that the economic situation of the country had become worse and that the interest rate of ORG had changed .

CARDINAL . On DATE , ORG dismissed the appeal arguing that the contract of DATE was legal and valid and therefore had to be upheld by the parties . ASITO lodged an appeal in cassation against this judgment .

CARDINAL . In the meantime , on an unspecified date , ORG lodged an “ appeal in the interests of the law ” with ORG . According to ORG , the appeal had the purpose of clarifying the controversy surrounding all such contracts and of setting a uniform practice for all the courts .

CARDINAL . On DATE , ORG issued a judgment deciding the dispute between ORG and the pension beneficiaries in favour of the former . It also ruled that its judgment had no retrospective effect on any already existing judgments and that it could not be used against the parties to those proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE , a panel of ORG composed of judges PERSON ( president ) , GPE and GPE , quashed the judgments of DATE and CARDINAL DATE , and found in favour of ORG .

CARDINAL . After the delivery of the judgment , the applicant found out that the mandate of Judge PERSON , who had presided at the hearing , had expired in DATE and that he had been dismissed from the position of judge in DATE .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the LAW of the NORP GPE of DATE provided as follows :
The judges ... shall be elected by ORG for a term of office of DATE .
CARDINAL . The Decision of the Supreme NORP of GPE , No . CARDINAL of DATE provided :
... ORG is appointed as a judge at ORG ...
CARDINAL . The Presidential Decree No . CARDINAL of DATE , in so far as relevant , provided :
ORG is dismissed from the position of judge .
CARDINAL . The relevant parts of LAW in force at the material time read as follows :
Section CARDINAL . The grounds for challenging a judge
A judge shall not be admitted to sit in a case and shall be challenged in the following cases :
CARDINAL ) NORP if he or she participated in an earlier stage of the proceedings as a witness , expert , interpreter , representative , prosecutor , registrar ;
CARDINAL ) NORP if he or she is personally interested , directly or indirectly , in the outcome of the proceedings or if there are other reasons for which his impartiality could be doubted ;
CARDINAL ) NORP if he , his spouse , his ascendants or descendants have any interest in the outcome of the proceedings ... ;
CARDINAL ) NORP if his spouse ... is a relative of one of the parties to the proceedings ... ;
CARDINAL ) NORP if he is a tutor ... of one of the parties to the proceedings .
Section CARDINAL . Adjourning the hearing

It is possible to request the adjournment of a hearing when one of the parties , a witness , an expert or an interpreter is absent , or when it is necessary to present new evidence or when there are other circumstances which render impossible the holding of the hearing .
CARDINAL . On DATE a new Code of Civil Procedure entered into force . Section CARDINAL , so far as relevant , reads as follows :
“ Grounds for revision
Revision may be requested :

k ) When ORG has found a violation of fundamental rights and liberties , as well as when it has found that the interested person could obtain , in accordance with domestic law , at least partial reparation by way of annulment of a judgment pronounced by a domestic court .... ”
